intro: Haplocarpha rueppellii, commonly known as the Cape mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, inconspicuous fruit capsules. Haplocarpha rueppellii is often found in mountainous regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
